question:
Which among the following statements is/are correct about coastal climates?
  1. Coastal climate is the Koppen classification of climate typical of west coasts in higher middle latitudes of continents.
  2. Oceanic climates in Europe occur mostly in Northwest Europe, from Ireland and Great Britain eastward to central Europe.
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation: An oceanic climate is also known as a marine climate or temperate oceanic climate. The KÃ¶ppen classification of climate typical of west coasts in higher middle latitudes of continents. It typically lacks a dry season, as precipitation is more evenly dispersed throughout the year. Oceanic climates in Europe occur mostly in Northwest Europe, from Ireland and Great Britain eastward to central Europe.
